identity.name: Capgemini Corporate Newsletter
identity.theme: Light Mode (Corporate Standard with Editorial Flair)

typography.instructions: Import fonts via Google Fonts in index.css: @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@300;400;500;600&family=Playfair+Display:wght@400;600;700&display=swap');

navbar.style: fixed top-0 left-0 right-0 z-50 bg-white/90 backdrop-blur-md border-b border-gray-100 shadow-sm
navbar.link_style: text-sm font-medium text-gray-600 hover:text-[#0070AD] transition-colors relative group
navbar.active_indicator: absolute -bottom-4 left-0 w-full h-0.5 bg-[#0070AD] scale-x-0 group-hover:scale-x-100 transition-transform

card.base: bg-white rounded-2xl border border-gray-100 shadow-sm hover:shadow-lg hover:-translate-y-1 transition-all duration-300 overflow-hidden group

button.primary: bg-[#0070AD] text-white px-6 py-2.5 rounded-full font-medium hover:bg-[#005c8f] hover:shadow-md transition-all active:scale-95
button.outline: bg-transparent border border-[#0070AD] text-[#0070AD] px-6 py-2.5 rounded-full font-medium hover:bg-blue-50 transition-all

visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle noise texture on backgrounds if possible for 'paper' feel.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text is #1F2937 on white backgrounds. Use #2B0A3D for headings for extra contrast.

sales.alt: Abstract blue light streaks representing growth

sustainability.alt: Deer near solar panels - Nature and Tech

setup: Initialize a React project if not present.
Install Tailwind CSS and Lucide React.
Add the Google Fonts import to index.css immediately.
implementation_strategy: Create a 'Layout' component that includes the Fixed Navbar and Footer.
Use 'react-router-dom' for section-based routing (even if content is static for now, structure it for routing).
Implement the 'Bento Grid' on the Home page to showcase all sections as teaser cards.
Each section page should have a consistent header layout: Title + Hero Image + Content Area.

Since content is from Google Docs, create a 'ContentRenderer' component that can take HTML string and sanitize/style it using 'dompurify' (mock this for now with dummy text if needed, but structure it).
Use the provided image URLs strictly.
universal_guidelines: Do NOT use gradients for text.
Do NOT use generic 'Lorem Ipsum' if possible - use context-aware placeholders (e.g., 'Latest updates from the sales team...').
Ensure all interactive elements have hover states.
Use 'data-testid' for all buttons and links.
